meanings.definition: The act of thinking deeply or pondering.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, she sat in her room, thunking about the meaning of life.
meanings.sent2: His thunking about the problem led to a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent3: While thunking about what to have for dinner, she realized she had forgotten to buy groceries.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of thunking, trying to make sense of the complex situation.
meanings.sent5: The thunking in his head was so loud, he could hardly focus on anything else.

meanings.definition: A sound made when hitting something solid.
meanings.sent1: The thunking of the hammer against the nail echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: He heard a loud thunking as the heavy book fell off the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The thunking of the basketball hitting the court signaled the start of the game.
meanings.sent4: The thunking of the door closing behind her made her realize she had left her keys inside.
meanings.sent5: The thunking of the drumbeat set the rhythm for the dancers.

meanings.definition: A programming technique used in computer science.
meanings.sent1: The programmer used thunking to optimize the code for faster execution.
meanings.sent2: Thunking is a useful method for handling asynchronous operations in programming.
meanings.sent3: The team had a good laugh when they realized the bug was caused by a simple mistake in thunking.
meanings.sent4: Using thunking in the algorithm was like adding a secret ingredient that made it work perfectly.
meanings.sent5: Her understanding of thunking helped her create more efficient programs.
